[et_pb_section admin_label=”section”][et_pb_row admin_label=”row”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″][et_pb_image admin_label=”Image” src=”https://www.convergences.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Ami-GOUV_PRINCIER_MONACO-Logo-2015_QUADRI-1.jpg” show_in_lightbox=”off” url=”http://en.gouv.mc/Portail-du-gouvernement” url_new_window=”off” use_overlay=”off” animation=”left” sticky=”off” align=”left” force_fullwidth=”off” always_center_on_mobile=”on” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” /][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”2_3″][et_pb_text admin_label=”Texte” background_layout=”light” text_orientation=”justified” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid”]

Monaco Government, through its public aid for development and international cooperation policy, has made the fight against poverty a priority for intervention. Each year, over 130 projects are supported by the Government in 12 countries, mainly among the Least Developed Countries (LCD) in the world: Madagascar, Mali, Burkina Faso, Niger, Mauritania, Senegal and Burundi. Monegasque aid focuses on three areas of intervention: health, education for all and socio-economic integration, with a core focus on the most vulnerable populations (children, women, refugees, people with disabilities…).

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_social_media_follow admin_label=”Suivez-nous sur les réseaux sociaux” link_shape=”rounded_rectangle” background_layout=”light” url_new_window=”off” follow_button=”off”] [et_pb_social_media_follow_network social_network=”facebook” url=”https://www.facebook.com/GvtMonaco/” skype_action=”call” bg_color=”#3b5998″] Facebook [/et_pb_social_media_follow_network][et_pb_social_media_follow_network social_network=”twitter” url=”https://twitter.com/GovMonaco” skype_action=”call” bg_color=”#00aced”] Twitter [/et_pb_social_media_follow_network] [/et_pb_social_media_follow][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
